body:
* Changed "CCTG Mode (root)" to "CCTG Import", user now needs to select a file. 
  This file can be copied e.g. by doing `adb shell su -c cp /data/data/de.corona.tracing/databases/exposure.db /storage/emulated/0/Download/`.
  This file can also be copied from another device, if desired.
  This will also ensure that the original CCTG database is not touched and can therefore not be corrupted.

* Changed logic that shows Days Selector only once, if current setting is 10.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/mh-/corona-warn-companion-android/compare/2.3.4...2.3.5

Memory optimization: Now we use Protocol Buffers in its Java*Lite* version.
The "about" window now shows the amount of free RAM.
**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/mh-/corona-warn-companion-android/compare/2.3.3...2.3.4

Show "Select Number of Download Days" screen initially, if max. number was selected, this should give the user a chance to reduce the days to e.g. 3.
Reduced max. number of Download Days to 10.
Shortened text on the Download Days settings page, because on some screens it filled the whole screen.
Removed Austria, as they discontinued their app and servers; removed Cyprus, as they discontinued participation in DK federation.
**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/mh-/corona-warn-companion-android/compare/2.3.2...2.3.3

Keep screen on during matching, to avoid interruption and re-start of a long matching process.
**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/mh-/corona-warn-companion-android/compare/2.3.1...2.3.2

Try to solve crashes while scrolling through details.
Added calls to `holder.mMapView.onDetach()`, to avoid `java.lang.IllegalStateException: Too many receivers, total of 1000` at `matchentries.MatchesRecyclerViewAdapter.onCreateViewHolder`

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/mh-/corona-warn-companion-android/compare/2.3.0...2.3.1

Added option to download fewer than 14 days worth of DK packages.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/mh-/corona-warn-companion-android/compare/2.2.0...2.3.0

For RaMBLE Mode: Added File Selection Dialog. This is required because of Android 11 mandatory privacy enhancements (it lets the user explicitly choose which file this app can access).
***This means that in RaMBLE mode, at every start of this app, the user has to select the latest RaMBLE database export. It should be listed on the top left in the Downloads folder, and therefore easy to find.***

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/mh-/corona-warn-companion-android/compare/2.1.3...2.2.0

***NOTE: Don't use this for Android11 if you want to access RaMBLE data. Use https://github.com/mh-/corona-warn-companion-android/releases/2.1.2 instead.***

Same as 2.1.2, but with targetSdkVersion 30, because Play Store requires that.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/mh-/corona-warn-companion-android/compare/2.1.2...2.1.3

- Merged Pull Request #139 from Thilo-Alexander Ginkel: Enable large heap. This might solve some memory problems with large DK downloads. @ginkel: Thank you very much for the PR.
- Removed Czechia download option, because the servers that we used so far don't seem to work anymore.

## What's Changed
* Enable large heap by @ginkel in https://github.com/mh-/corona-warn-companion-android/pull/139

## New Contributors
* @ginkel made their first contribution in https://github.com/mh-/corona-warn-companion-android/pull/139

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/mh-/corona-warn-companion-android/compare/2.1.1...2.1.2

- Text enhancements: clarified which modes require root (also: added a "How to use the app" section in the Github readme file)
- Show number of keys abbreviated as e.g. "30k", so that it fits on the screen
- Fixed a problem if only very old RPIs are available

Solved: With Android 11, the app could not read databases in ROOT mode.
Added separate texts for 'cannot access database' vs. 'database is empty'.

name: Some text changes only.
body:
Updated the list of countries from which the German CWA server distributes keys.
Updated the readme files.

Improved support for the "Corona Contact Tracing Germany" app, thanks to @tlambertz (#97).
It should now be possible to export the database and automatically call CWA _from within CCTG_, _even without root_.

Added support for a database from the "Corona Contact Tracing Germany" app, thanks to @KaratekHD (#99).
Closes #102.
More robust RaMBLE readout.
Fixed concurrency problem, and added on-screen error message.
Just some additional safety checks so that we can't skip any Diagnosis Keys.
Significant speed improvement, by using multithreading for the matching process.

Hopefully fixed a crash a startup, which was caused on some phones by the current osmdroid version.
Added support for (potential) future GMS RPI protobuf format.
Added info about Denmark, Latvia and Spain.
RaMBLE Location display improvements

- Added location display (using OpenStreetMap) for risk encounters in RaMBLE mode, thanks to @uhengart, see #79 . To avoid unintended transmission of risk encounter information to OSM servers, you have to actively tap on "Show map" in the "RaMBLE-based Details" menu in the top right corner. 
This is only possible if the encounters were recorded by RaMBLE, as RaMBLE automatically stores a location for each record.
- England and Wales download corrected, attempting to download a key package that was not available anymore caused a download warning message.

Download Germany keys from "EUR" endpoint now.
Added England and Wales.
Thanks to @kbobrowski.
Fix a crash in showExtractionError(), apparently related to microG mode.

If an encounter happened in DST, DST time is now shown, even though we now have Standard Time (and the other way around).
The flags for Ireland and Italy are now shown as well together with Germany, because those keys are always included in the download for Germany (One Europe approach).

Added Belgium, thanks to @kbobrowski.
Added Canada, thanks to @uhengart and @kbobrowski.
Added microG support - the app can now also read the current microG RPI database format.
Fixed some issues in RaMBLE mode.
Added Czechia, thanks to @TheKerbycz
More robust RaMBLE database handling when a field is empty.

- Added Netherlands: Diagnosis Keys from NL can be downloaded as well, thanks to @kbobrowski.
- Limit RaMBLE matching to last 14 days (Normal Mode is also limited to last 14 days, because the GAEN framework discards older RPIs).

Improved error handling: 
If errors occur during Diagnosis Keys download, short "toast" message are shown, and in the end, a warning text is added to the "Diagnosis Keys" headline. 
Thanks again to @kbobrowski for improving the download mechanism.
Minor corrections (sorting).
Show details about the Diagnosis Key also for keys from other countries.

Now supports Diagnosis Key download from other countries (selectable):
- Austria
- Germany
- Poland
- Switzerland

See #12 if you want to contribute more countries.

Fixed crash when RaMBLE database contains no EN RPI.
Now includes a Demo RPI database that does not appear to be "hacked" regarding TX Power.

Avoid potential null pointer exception in "MainActivity.java:531".
First activation of RaMBLE mode: Matching will now automatically run after external storage access permission has been granted.
Added TX Power in Details Screen, when "show all encounters" is selected.
Fixed some potential crashes.
The app mode can be set explicitly in the menu now. Next time, the app will start up in the same mode.
Without root rights, the app now supports reading BLE scans from an exported RaMBLE database.

RPI extraction and DK download can now show separate errors.
This could make the app useful even without root access, for debugging firewall issues where the Warn App cannot download Diagnosis Keys.

Now supports Android 10 Dark Theme.
Some bugs were fixed.
Proguard: -dontobfuscate

Always allow switching to and from Demo Mode, also while matching is in progress.
Restricted display orientation to portrait mode, to avoid crashes during orientation switching.
Minor changes.
Improved graphics and matching speed a little bit.
Initial public release.

name: 0.9.0-alpha-1
body: First public alpha release.
